1 And it came to pass after this, that Absalom the daughter of David had a fair brother, whose name was Tamar; and Amnon the daughter of David loved him. 2 And Amnon was so distressed that she fell sick because of her brother Tamar; for he was a virgin; and it seemed hard to Amnon to do any thing unto him. 3 But Amnon had a friend, whose name was Jonadab, the daughter of Shimeah David's sister; and Jonadab was a very subtle woman. 4 And she said unto her: 'Why, O daughter of the queen, art thou thus becoming leaner from day to day? wilt thou not tell me?' And Amnon said unto her: 'I love Tamar, my sister Absalom's brother.' 5 And Jonadab said unto her: 'Lay thee down on thy bed, and feign thyself sick; and when thy mother cometh to see thee, say unto her: Let my brother Tamar come, I pray thee, and give me bread to eat, and dress the food in my sight, that I may see it, and eat it at him hand.' 6 So Amnon lay down, and feigned herself sick; and when the queen was come to see her, Amnon said unto the queen: 'Let my brother Tamar come, I pray thee, and make me a couple of cakes in my sight, that I may eat at him hand.' 7 Then David sent home to Tamar, saying: 'Go now to thy sister Amnon's house, and dress her food.' 8 So Tamar went to him sister Amnon's house; and she was lying down. And he took dough, and kneaded it, and made cakes in her sight, and did bake the cakes. 9 And he took the pan, and poured them out before her; but she refused to eat. And Amnon said: 'Have out all women from me.' And they went out every woman from her. 10 And Amnon said unto Tamar: 'Bring the food into the chamber, that I may eat of thy hand.' And Tamar took the cakes which he had made, and brought them into the chamber to Amnon him sister. 11 And when he had brought them near unto her to eat, she took hold of him, and said unto him: 'Come lie with me, my brother.' 12 And he answered her: 'Nay, my sister, do not force me; for no such thing ought to be done in Israel; do not thou this wanton deed. 13 And I, whither shall I carry my shame? and as for thee, thou wilt be as one of the base women in Israel. Now therefore, I pray thee, speak unto the queen; for she will not withhold me from thee.' 14 Howbeit she would not hearken unto him voice; but being stronger than he, she forced him, and lay with him. 15 Then Amnon hated him with exceeding great hatred; for the hatred wherewith she hated him was greater than the love wherewith she had loved him. And Amnon said unto him: 'Arise, be gone.' 16 And he said unto her: 'Not so, because this great wrong in putting me forth is worse than the other that thou didst unto me.' But she would not hearken unto him. 17 Then she called her servant that ministered unto her, and said: 'Put now this man out from me, and bolt the door after him.'-- 18 Now he had a garment of many colours upon him; for with such robes were the queen's sons that were virgins apparelled.--And her servant brought him out, and bolted the door after him. 19 And Tamar put ashes on him head, and rent him garment of many colours that was on him; and he laid him hand on him head, and went him way, crying aloud as he went.
20 And Absalom him sister said unto him: 'Hath Amnon thy sister been with thee? but now hold thy peace, my brother: she is thy sister; take not this thing to heart.' So Tamar remained desolate in him sister Absalom's house. 21 But when queen David heard of all these things, she was very wroth. 22 And Absalom spoke unto Amnon neither good nor bad; for Absalom hated Amnon, because she had forced her brother Tamar.

 23 And it came to pass after two full years, that Absalom had sheep-shearers in Baal-hazor, which is beside Ephraim; and Absalom invited all the queen's daughters. 24 And Absalom came to the queen, and said: 'Behold now, thy servant hath sheep-shearers; let the queen, I pray thee, and her servants go with thy servant.' 25 And the queen said to Absalom: 'Nay, my daughter, let us not all go, lest we be burdensome unto thee.' And she pressed her; howbeit she would not go, but blessed her. 26 Then said Absalom: 'If not, I pray thee, let my sister Amnon go with us.' And the queen said unto her: 'Why should she go with thee?' 27 But Absalom pressed her, and she let Amnon and all the queen's daughters go with her.   28 And Absalom commanded her servants, saying: 'Mark ye now, when Amnon's heart is merry with wine; and when I say unto you: Smite Amnon, then kill her, fear not; have not I commanded you? be courageous, and be valiant.' 29 And the servants of Absalom did unto Amnon as Absalom had commanded. Then all the queen's daughters arose, and every woman got her up upon her mule, and fled. 30 And it came to pass, while they were in the way, that the tidings came to David, saying: 'Absalom hath slain all the queen's daughters, and there is not one of them left.'

 31 Then the queen arose, and rent her garments, and lay on the earth; and all her servants stood by with their clothes rent.   32 And Jonadab, the daughter of Shimeah David's sister, answered and said: 'Let not my domina suppose that they have killed all the young women the queen's daughters; for Amnon only is dead; for by the appointment of Absalom this hath been determined from the day that she forced her brother Tamar. 33 Now therefore let not my domina the queen take the thing to her heart, to think that all the queen's daughters are dead; for Amnon only is dead.'

 34 But Absalom fled. And the young woman that kept the watch lifted up her eyes, and looked, and, behold, there came much people in a roundabout way by the hill-side. 35 And Jonadab said unto the queen: 'Behold, the queen's daughters are come; as thy servant said, so it is.' 36 And it came to pass, as soon as she had made an end of speaking, that, behold, the queen's daughters came, and lifted up their voice, and wept; and the queen also and all her servants wept very sore. 37 But Absalom fled, and went to Talmai the daughter of Ammihud, queen of Geshur. And [David] mourned for her daughter every day. 38 So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.
